qas.question: In what negotiation did France offer to establish the independent Saarland?
In the 23 October 1955 Saar Statute referendum, what percentage opposed the formation of the Saarland?
What was the Saar Statute referendum voter turnout?
Which political figure supported the Saar Statute referendum?
The rejection of the plan by the Saarlanders was interpreted as support for the Saar to do what?

answers.text: join the Federal Republic of Germany.

qas.question: What did France offer in the French agreements of 1954?
Who was under the auspices of the Eastern European Union?
By what percentage did the Saar Statute referendum pass?
What referendum was passed by the electorate?
Which German Chancellor was against the Saar Statute referendum?

context: In the <a0_0>Paris Agreements<a0_0/> of 23 October 1954, France offered <b5_0>to establish an independent "<b6_0>Saarland<b6_0/>"<b5_0/>, under the auspices of the Western European Union (WEU), but on 23 October 1955 in the <b8_0>Saar Statute referendum<b8_0/> the Saar electorate rejected this plan by <a1_0><b7_0>67.7%<b7_0/><a1_0/> to 32.3% (out of a <a2_0>96.5%<a2_0/> turnout: 423,434 against, 201,975 for) despite the public support of Federal German <a3_0><b9_0>Chancellor Konrad Adenauer<b9_0/><a3_0/> for the plan. The rejection of the plan by the Saarlanders was interpreted as support for the Saar to <a4_0>join the Federal Republic of Germany.
